summary.p: 173 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 210; Qurʾānic Text: 19:1-end; 18 lines per page; Dimensions: 205 x 295mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 26: "78 E.H. 210 Kur’an’ın 2. yarısı. Aharlı kalınca kâğıt. 295mm boy ve 205mm eninde 173 yaprak. Sahifede tahminen V. asır kûfisi ile 170mm uzunl.[uğunda] 18 satır, harekeler kırmızı ile konmuştur. Miklep ve yazma şemselı koyu yeşil deri cilt. Bu ciltte Kur’anın Maryam (19) suresinin başından Nās (114) suresinin sonuna kadardır. Sonunda hatım duası vardır."

This can be translated as follows: "78 E.H. 210. The second half of the Qurʾān. Thick sized paper. 173 leaves of 295 mm height and 205 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script with red diacritical marks of 5th century [contains] 18 lines measuring 170 mm. Dark green leather binding with flap (miklep) and mandorla (yazma şemse). In this part, it contains from the beginning of Q 19 (Sūra Maryam) to the end of Q 114 (Sūra al-Nās). At the end, there is a finishing (khatm) prayer.”
